message:
hello guys .. I was wondering about copyrights of open source projects .. let's assume that I have this wonderful library that is hosted on one of the famous code hosting vendors .. codeplex, github, etc.

could this be enough to retain my copyright as an author ?!!!

should I reserve a specific domain name for the code ?!!

is there a foundation that could connect my identity to my work and ensure my copyrights ??

looking for your insights pleaase :)

data.message: Seriously? Open source by definition is anti-copyright

emm .. I may be missing something here .. but I've read the GPL license  for example and it keeps my copyright as I am the contributor .. also a question raise here .. the name of the library or the project can be trademark .. or what !!!  .. is it allowed to change the license of the project  from open source into closed source ??  .. as I remember there are many companies that give you an open source license to use in addition to other license for commercial use.

Don't get mixed up between patent and copyright and trademark, the three are very completely different things ... ana nafsy kol shewayya batla7'bat ba3d ma2ra el far2, so don't ask me :D
The one I'm sure of is trademark, which is your registered name and logo, I don't think any of the usual opensource licenses allow people to use your trademark as if it's theirs (maybe WTFPL is an exception :D)
